items.100: This coastal city serves as the summer home of the 41st President of the United States
items.200: This city is home to the first Tower Records store, which opened in 1960
items.300: The words "California Republic" were first raised on a flag in this city as part of the "Bear Flag Revolt" in 1846
items.400: The Italian sandwich was invented in this Maine city in 1903
items.500: During Prohibition, the mayor of this city, known as the "Napolean of Temperance", was raided, an event known as the Rum Riot

items.100: Opened in 1879, this building is the oldest in Golden Gate Park
items.200: This floral visitor is the state insect of Maine
items.300: This company began in 1912 by selling a single product, the Maine Hunting Shoe
items.400: This Tahoe resort is the largest ski area in California
items.500: The name of this National Park means "killer" in Miwok

items.100: This Portland, ME brewery distributes nationally and focuses on Belgian-style beers
items.200: The chardonnay from this winery won first prize in the "Judgement of Paris" wine tasting in 1976
items.300: The largest brewer in Maine, this brewing company produces beers such as Island Time IPA, Monkey Fist IPA, and Little Horror of Hops
items.400: This Sonoma winery is the oldest commercial winery in California
items.500: The slogan for this Bay Area brewery is "celebrate the right to be original"

items.100: This state has the most forest cover (89%) in the US
items.200: "Ladies night" is against the law in this state
items.300: This state has the longest coastline in the contiguous United States
items.400: This state has the highest percentage of people speaking French at home
items.500: This state is the first in the nation to use "instant run-off" (also known as "ranked-choice voting") for statewide elections

items.100: The Guinness Book of World Records named this bridge for being the widest in the world
items.200: "Firebelle Lil" was the benefactor for the construction of this San Francisco landmark
items.300: This California island is known as "Ellis Island West", serving as an entry point for immigrants from East Asia
items.400: Machias Seal Island and North Rock are disputed territories claimed by Maine, USA and this region of Canada
items.500: A colony of New France, this area included parts of Quebec and modern-day Maine

items.100: This California state motto is the Greek word for "I found it!"
items.200: This American author of horror and supernatual fiction has homes in Bangor and Lovell, Maine
items.300: The owner of Chez Panisse, this chef and restauranteur helped define California cuisine
items.400: This variety of thistle plant is the  state vegetable of California
items.500: Following World War II, Maine produced over 75 billion of these small pointed pieces of wood each year
